Walter is survived by his brother, Douglas Smead (pictured above) of Corinth, and sister, Harriet Eggleston of Saratoga Springs; as well as many nieces, nephews, and cousins. 🇺🇸
His remains were identified using DNA technology and anthropological analysis in the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency (DPAA) laboratory at Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam in Hawaii on March 16, 2021.

He was added to the list of presumed dead in December of 1953 and was promoted to Corporal posthumously. Corporal Smead’s remains were included in the 55 boxes returned to the United States following the summit between President Trump and North Korea in June 2018.
Private First Class Smead was listed as missing in action (MIA) on December 6, 1950, after his unit was attacked while attempting to withdraw near the Chosin Reservoir in North Korea.
